alert.note: Alert for Coeur d'Alene Area; Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 7:06AM MST until January 09 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 3 to 6 inches. Locally higher amounts possible Idaho Palouse to north of Coeur d`Alene. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph Tuesday. * WHERE...Plummer, Grand Coulee, Oakesdale, Post Falls, Coeur d`Alene, Harrington, Worley, Moscow, Creston, Rockford, Airway Heights, Uniontown, La Crosse, Spokane Valley, Tekoa, Potlatch, Cheney, Genesee, Pullman, Rosalia, Hayden, Davenport, Ritzville, Downtown Spokane, Colfax, Coulee City, Wilbur, Fairfield, and Odessa. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slick road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact travel Monday evening through Tuesday. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Localized higher snow amounts possible where snow is slow to transition to rain Tuesday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
